intro: Axyris caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian axyris, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
